meanings.definition: The ability to perceive or feel things.
meanings.sent1: Sentience allows us to experience the world around us.
meanings.sent2: Animals show sentience when they react to their environment.
meanings.sent3: The robot's unexpected display of sentience startled the scientists.
meanings.sent4: In the artist's painting, the colors seemed to possess a sense of sentience.
meanings.sent5: The writer's vivid description brought the character's sentience to life.

meanings.sent1: Her sentience of the danger saved her from harm.
meanings.sent2: Meditation can help increase one's sentience of their thoughts and emotions.
meanings.sent3: The cat's curious sentience of the new toy was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The city's sentience of bustling activity was palpable in the air.
meanings.sent5: The child's innocent sentience of the world was a joy to witness.
